articles.title: Argentina: Markets give tepid welcome to new economy chief
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — The market welcomed Argentina’s new Economy Minister Sergio Massa on Thursday with what appeared to be a cautiously optimistic attitude amid questions about how he would fulfill a key goal of reducing the fiscal deficit, while leftist groups criticized his initial plans that they said would inevitably lead to strong austerity measures.
articles.content: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — The market welcomed Argentina’s new Economy Minister Sergio Massa on Thursday with what appeared to be a cautiously optimistic attitude amid questions about how he would fulfill a key goal of reducing the fiscal deficit... [3880 chars]

articles.title: Bizarrap & Quevedo Top Argentina Hot 100 Chart for Third Week
articles.description: Bizarrap and Quevedo nab a third week at No. 1 on the Billboard Argentina Hot 100 chart as “Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 52” holds strong.
articles.content:
Bizarrap and Quevedo nab a third week at No. 1 on the Billboard Argentina Hot 100 chart as “Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 52” holds strong atop the July 30-dated survey.

articles.title: Wallabies 2022: Australia team to play Argentina, Rugby Championship, Quade Cooper, Michael Cheika, squad, updates, news, video
articles.description: Wallabies make seven changes for Cheika Test as Rennie ends Petaia experiment before it started
articles.content:
Three minutes. That’s how long Dave Rennie’s experiment with Jordan Petaia has lasted at fullback, with the Reds back shifted to the wing for the Wallabies’ crunch Test against Michael Cheika’s Pumas.

articles.title: Argentina's Massa pitches 'fiscal order' to stop economic free-fall
articles.description: Argentina's new economy minister, Sergio Massa, announced a list of measures on Wednesday aimed at healing the country's ailing finances, including pledges to meet a key deficit target and stick with already agreed debt payments.

articles.title: Argentina's Massa sworn in as economy chief, budget cuts expected
articles.description: Argentina's latest economy minister, Sergio Massa, formally took the reins of his newly-dubbed "superministry" on Wednesday, with expectations that he will announce spending cuts to calm markets amid a deepening economic crisis.
